MGNREGA is gone: What the new VB‑GRAM bill means for rural India
description:
A major shift has occurred in India’s rural employment system. The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) has been replaced by a new law, which promises 125 days of work and a redesigned funding structure.

In this explainer, we break down what has changed, why this transition matters, and how the new framework could reshape rural labour and public works across India.

We look at the key features of the Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, how it differs from MGNREGA, and what early reactions from experts, policymakers, and workers signal about its impact.

Presentation: Sharmada Venkatasubramanian
Video: Thamodharan B
Script and Editing: Shikha Kumari A

'Don’t have next generation': Polgár, Rapport and changing faces of Hungarian chess
description: Hungary’s rich chess legacy, built by legends like Lajos Portisch, Judit Polgár and Peter Lékó, has thinned in recent years. Country's top-ranked player Richárd Rapport remains the lone elite standard-bearer after the 2014 Olympiad silver. He cites a lack of institutional support and fading continuity, but hopes leadership and reform can revive Hungarian chess’s former glory.

title: Epstein files: Trump's name appears in latest file drop; listed as passenger on 8 private jet flights
description: Newly released DOJ records include an internal email stating that Donald Trump was listed as a passenger on at least eight flights aboard Jeffrey Epstein’s private jet between 1993 and 1996. The email, written by an assistant US attorney, details occasions when Ghislaine Maxwell and members of Trump’s family were also listed as passengers, while noting specific flights involving Epstein and potential witnesses. The disclosure is part of a broader release of thousands of Epstein-related documents.

Not just Call of Duty: How Vince Zampella changed first-person shooter video games
description: Zampella’s defining contribution was not graphical fidelity or technical ambition. It was mood. He understood that tension lives in restraint, that immersion deepens when players hesitate, and that fear is most effective when it feels earned rather than theatrical.

Twelve arrests have been made as authorities investigate the deliberate circulation of misinformation.

Ashes 2025: 'Five or six days of drinking' — England players' behaviour set for review
description: England's cricket board will investigate claims of excessive player drinking during a mid-Ashes break in Noosa, Queensland. Managing director Rob Key stated that while he supports players switching off, heavy drinking is unacceptable.  He confirmed the matter would be looked into if reports of prolonged alcohol consumption prove accurate, emphasizing the need for professionalism.

title: Magnesium and dementia risk: What happens to your brain when you take magnesium daily
description: New research suggests that increasing magnesium intake could significantly benefit brain health and potentially lower dementia risk. Studies indicate higher magnesium levels are linked to larger brain volume and fewer lesions, suggesting a younger-looking brain. Incorporating magnesium-rich foods like leafy greens, nuts, and seeds is recommended for optimal cognitive function as we age.

title: Meet ‘Super Mario’: The man living on cruise ships for 25 years with no home on land
description: Financial advisor Mario Salcedo has lived on cruise ships for 25 years, embracing a life without a fixed address.  He works remotely, managing client portfolios while enjoying the structure and constant motion.  Despite a health condition exacerbated by land, his unique lifestyle offers him a sense of home and predictability, challenging conventional notions of belonging.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s apology after Chiefs’ playoff exit
description: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzola’s combined net worth in 2025
description: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: 'Every man's life ends the same way...': Quote of the day by Ernest Hemingway
description: Ernest Hemingway was one of the most popular authors of  war and life's struggles fueled timeless novels like 'The Old Man and the Sea,' celebrated for its profound wisdom. Hemingway's 'iceberg theory' influenced generations, emphasizing understated emotion and the enduring significance of how one lives, not just the inevitable end.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
description: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to more predictable automation. Executives admit a decline in AI model trust, citing instances where agents missed instructions or lost focus. This move follows significant staff reductions attributed to AI deployment, as the company navigates the gap between AI hype and practical business needs.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside Aaron Rodgers’ wife as marriage mystery deepens
description: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.
